ai-sn24:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove.
ai-sn24:1.1.3_0: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does view arises:
ai-sn24:1.1.4_0: ‘Winds don’t blow; rivers don’t flow; pregnant women don’t give birth; the moon and stars neither rise nor set, but stand firm like a pillar.’”
ai-sn24:1.2.1_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha.
ai-sn24:1.2.1_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-sn24:1.2.1_2: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-sn24:1.2.2_0: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

ai-sn24:1.5.1_0: “When a noble disciple has given up doubt in these six cases, and has given up doubt in suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation,
ai-sn24:1.5.2_0: Such a noble disciple is called a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”

ai-sn24:5.1.2_0: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does view arises:
ai-sn24:5.1.3_0: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings.
ai-sn24:5.1.3_1: there is no other world, there is no afterlife.
ai-sn24:5.1.3_2: There’s no ascetic or brahmin who practices like this.
ai-sn24:5.1.4_0: This person is made up of the four primary elements. When they die, the earth in their body merges and coalesces with the main mass of earth. The water in their body merges and coalesces with the main mass of water. The fire in their body merges and coalesces with the main mass of fire. The air in their body merges and coalesces with the main mass of air.
ai-sn24:5.1.6_0: Four men with a bier carry away the corpse.
ai-sn24:5.1.10_0: Giving is a doctrine for morons.
ai-sn24:5.1.11_0: When anyone affirms a positive teaching it’s just hollow, false nonsense.
ai-sn24:5.1.12_0: Both the foolish and the astute are annihilated and destroyed when their body breaks up, and they don’t exist after death.’”
ai-sn24:5.1.13_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. ...

ai-sn24:5.2.2_0: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings. ...

ai-sn24:6.1.2_0: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does view arises:
ai-sn24:6.1.3_0: the one who acts does a bad deed when they punish, etc.
ai-sn24:6.1.4_0: If you were to reduce all the living creatures of this earth to one heap and mass of flesh with a razor-edged chakram, no evil comes of that, and no outcome of evil.
ai-sn24:6.1.5_1: killing and making others kill, destroying and making others destroy, no evil comes of that, and no outcome of evil.
ai-sn24:6.1.6_0: and northerning north to the Ganges.
ai-sn24:6.1.6_1: giving, teeth, and grueling, there is no merit or outcome of merit.
ai-sn24:6.1.7_0: In giving, self-control, restraint, and truthfulness there is no merit or outcome of merit.’”
ai-sn24:6.1.8_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. ...

ai-sn24:7.1.2_0: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does view arises:
ai-sn24:7.1.3_0: there’s no cause or condition for the corruption of sentient beings, etc.
ai-sn24:7.1.4_0: Sentient beings are corrupted with cause and reason.
ai-sn24:7.1.5_0: There’s no cause or condition for the purification of sentient beings.
ai-sn24:7.1.6_0: Sentient beings are purified without cause or reason.
ai-sn24:7.1.7_0: There is no power, no energy, no human strength or vigor.
ai-sn24:7.1.8_0: All sentient beings, all living creatures, all beings, all souls lack control, power, and energy. Molded by destiny, circumstance, and nature, they experience pleasure and pain in the six classes of rebirth’?”

ai-sn24:8.1.2_0: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does view arises:
ai-sn24:8.1.3_0: ‘There are these seven substances that are not made, not derived, not created, without a creator, barren, steady as a mountain peak, standing firm like a pillar.
ai-sn24:8.1.4_0: They don’t move or deteriorate or obstruct each other.
ai-sn24:8.1.4_1: not worth a fraction, or suffering,
ai-sn24:8.1.5_0: What are the teachings grouped by seven?
ai-sn24:8.1.6_0: The substances of earth, water, fire, air; pleasure, pain, and the soul is the seventh.
ai-sn24:8.1.7_0: These seven substances are not made, not derived, not created, without a creator, barren, steady as a mountain peak, standing firm like a pillar.
ai-sn24:8.1.8_0: They don’t move or deteriorate or obstruct each other.
ai-sn24:8.1.8_1: not worth a fraction, or suffering,
ai-sn24:8.1.9_0: If you chop off someone’s head with a sharp sword, you don’t take anyone’s life.
ai-sn24:8.1.10_0: The sword simply passes through the gap between the seven substances.
ai-sn24:8.1.11_0: There are 1.4 million main wombs, and 6,000, and 600. There are 500 deeds, and five, and three. There are deeds and half-deeds. There are 62 paths, 62 sub-eons, six classes of rebirth, and eight stages in a person’s life. There are 4,900 Ājīvaka ascetics, 4,900 wanderers, and 4,900 naked ascetics. There are 2,000 faculties, 3,000 hells, and 36 realms of dust. There are seven percipient embryos, seven non-percipient embryos, and seven embryos without attachments. There are seven gods, seven humans, and seven goblins. There are seven lakes, seven winds, seven cliffs, and 700 cliffs. There are seven dreams. There are 700 dreams. There are
ai-sn24:8.1.12_0: And here there is no such thing as this: “By this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life I shall force unripened deeds to bear their fruit, or eliminate old deeds by experiencing their results little by little” for that cannot be.
ai-sn24:8.1.13_0: Pleasure and pain are allotted. Transmigration lasts only for a limited period, so there’s no increase or decrease, no getting better or worse.
ai-sn24:8.1.14_0: It’s like how, when you toss a ball of string, it rolls away unraveling.
ai-sn24:8.1.15_0: In the same way, after transmigrating the foolish and the astute will make an end of suffering’?”
ai-sn24:8.1.16_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. ...

ai-sn24:18.3.11_0: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would such a view arise?”
ai-sn24:18.3.12_0: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’”
ai-sn24:18.4.1_0: “When a noble disciple has given up doubt in these six cases, and has given up doubt in suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation,
ai-sn24:18.4.2_0: Such a noble disciple is called a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
ai-sn24:18.4.5_0: The successive series on are finished.

ai-sn24:71.2.11_0: “But if they're impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn24:71.2.13_0: “But if they're impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn24:71.2.14_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn24:71.2.21_0: “But if they're impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”

ai-sn24:71.2.24_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn24:71.3.1_0: “So you should truly see any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near:
ai-sn24:71.3.1_1: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn24:71.3.2_0: Any kind of feeling at all ...
ai-sn24:71.3.4_0: Any kind of choices at all ...
ai-sn24:71.3.5_0: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near:
ai-sn24:71.3.5_1: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn24:71.4.2_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”

ai-sn24:96.4.1_0: “So you should truly see any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near:
ai-sn24:96.4.1_1: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn24:96.4.2_0: Any kind of feeling at all ...
ai-sn24:96.4.4_0: Any kind of choices at all ...
ai-sn24:96.4.5_0: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near:
ai-sn24:96.4.5_1: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn24:96.5.1_0: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn24:96.5.2_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
ai-sn24:96.5.3_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
